questions.label: Where are you now in your academic career & how do you feel towards it?

answers.label: I am exactly where I would like to be with regards to my day-to-day performance and grades, there is nothing I want to change or improve on
answers.descriptive_text: Outstanding work, keep up your great progress

answers.label: I am good at remembering information but would like to be more organised and efficient
answers.descriptive_text: It’s great to hear that you are good at remembering information. With regards to getting more organized and efficient - this will involve you staying really focused during your PL Lessons, around managing your time and organising yourself.  By giving you a clear process to organise your work, you will be prevented from feel overwhelmed when the amount of information you have to remember starts to increase.

answers.label: I am on track but have moments where I doubt myself and the progress I am making, I then get nervous especially when sitting tests and exams
answers.descriptive_text: Thank you for your honest answer. The three core reasons you doubt yourself, comes down to needing to improve on your abilities. These are: retaining more information, managing your time effectively and when it comes to exam times, managing your anxiety.  Your PL Curriculum will provide you with these skills - the challenges you face are only technical i.e. skills that can be learned.

answers.label: I am good in certain subjects but not so good in others, I want to improve this and be good in all my subjects
answers.descriptive_text: Brilliant, you’re in a great place.  As a first step; list the subjects you want to improve in and write down what specific areas you want to improve on.  You’ll find your strengths in the subjects you’re good at will either come down to you enjoying that subject more or having a natural ability to retain and recall the information in it. During your PL Curriculum, you will learn to bridge your very strong core skills to your weaker ones and therefore boosting your overall performance.

answers.label: I am under a lot of pressure to pass, it's becoming make or break for me
answers.descriptive_text: ‘Hang in’ there; we know you’re under a lot of stress and having a tough time at school.  Your PL Curriculum will teach you how to get back on track by focusing on the pure skills you need to learn to ‘get out of the mud’ and therefore delivering the results you know you can get.  Take a few deep breaths, write down all the areas you feel you need to make improvements in and get ready to turn things around.

answers.label: I am considering giving up formal education as I am not happy with my current situation at all
answers.descriptive_text: ‘Hang in’ there; we know you’re under a lot of stress and having an extremely difficult time.  You’re most likely feeling that way because you’ve had some ‘tough breaks’ recently. Remember everything has a solution! By participating in the PL Curriculum you will have the opportunity to take a closer, solutions orientated ‘look’ at what’s working and what isn’t.  You’ll then, on a weekly basis, be taught the skills to help you get back on track and get some good results in.

answers.label: I do not know, I have never given it any thought or consideration as I am not bothered either way
answers.descriptive_text: Thank you for your honesty here. It’s important for you to begin to focus on areas you feel you would like to improve on in school. Making these improvements is not as difficult, boring or frustrating as you may think.  During your PL Curriculum you will be given an amazing opportunity to really boost your performance and begin to enjoy being in school. Give yourself a chance and as an immediate next step, write a list of three areas you’d like to improve on.

answers.label: I get angry a lot as I find school frustrates me, teachers and students make me angry and I find it hard to control my emotions
answers.descriptive_text: First of all, congratulations on your honesty, it takes a strong person to admit they get angry and find it difficult at times to control their emotions.  During your PL Curriculum you will be taught how to manage your emotions and take control of the anger you feel and learn how to turn into a more positive, empowering emotion that will serve you in school.  You will also take a look at what’s causing that anger so you can get on your way to focusing on delivering your true talent in school rather then the frustration you’re feeling now.

answers.label: None of the above as I am happy with where I am right now
answers.descriptive_text: We suggest that you take another look at the answers and see if there is anything else that applies to you. If not, ‘great work’ as it’s a great place too be if you truly feel that there is nothing you would like to improve or focus on.  Make sure you keeping ‘checking in’ on yourself and always write down (even if it’s small) any areas you’d like to improve in. Be proactive in this, as it’ll ensure you keep your focus on what counts.

questions.label: Out of the following, what would you like to accomplish?

answers.label: I would like to manage my time a lot better than I currently do, I feel it's all last minute
answers.descriptive_text: You currently feel it’s last minute for two reasons: 1) At times feeling overwhelmed with the amount of information you have to learn.  2) Not having a structured method to stay on top of all the work you are given.  During your PL Curriculum, you will go through our PL Quadrant of Managing Time, which teaches you how to manage your time in a way that’s totally personalised to your learning style.

answers.label: I get really nervous towards exams and tests, I remember information and revise a lot but get too anxious
answers.descriptive_text: Great honesty. Managing nerves and anxiety, some say is the single most important factor in delivering excellent performance and it applies to all top performers.  Nerves and anxiety appear when you are worrying about an event in the future e.g. your exams are coming or you’re focusing on events and experiences e.g. failing an exam in the past. During your PL Curriculum, you will be taught how to eliminate all triggers of nerves and anxiety. You will be provided with tools and techniques to manage your nerves if they appear in an exam situation. Most importantly, in one of your PL Lessons you will be build your own pre-, during and -post exam routine, which will not only focus on the technical side to your performance but ensure you are in the right mindset to get the results you know you can.

answers.label: I try really hard but no matter how much I try I don't get better so I would like this to change
answers.descriptive_text: Thank you for your honesty, we know it can get really frustrating that despite how hard you try - you’re not getting the results you want or you deserve.  Often this comes down to where you are placing your focus and what skills you are learning in order to improve. Often, effort alone doesn’t produce results.  During your PL Curriculum you will take an in-depth look at and be taught with absolute precision - how to make huge improvements in the finer, more detailed areas of your performance. Examples would be; how you retain and recall information and how you manage your time on a weekly basis.  All of these skills will be directly linked to the subjects you feel you are struggling in so you can get back on track to producing outstanding results.

answers.label: I am not sure, I've never thought about what I want to accomplish, nothing really I guess
answers.descriptive_text: We understand it can be difficult at times to think about what you really want to accomplish. At this current stage of your academic life, it is important that you begin to think about what goals you have, where you want to be in a few years, whether it’s university or straight into work as well thinking in finer detail, which specific subjects you want to improve on.  Your PL Curriculum will cover this with you in detail, as well as giving you the opportunity and framework to make the improvements you may need to make - across your subjects.  Start off by writing down three areas you’d like to focus on during your PL Curriculum. This will be the first step to beginning to think about what you want to achieve.

answers.label: I would like at least two grades better then I am getting now
answers.descriptive_text: Outstanding, make sure you are ‘crystal clear’ on what subjects you would like to make those improvements in.  Achieving a two-grade improvement will require a lot of focus and dedication to your PL Curriculum and your schoolwork. During your PL Curriculum, you will be taught the specific skills you need - to be on your way to achieving this goal.  Your first step will involve improving your memory and how you manage your time. This will give you the ability to take in a lot more information and always be in control of your workload.  Get ready as the work begins shortly.

answers.label: Sometimes I struggle to stay awake in class and this affects my performance a lot.
answers.descriptive_text: We are sorry to hear this, at first instance it appears you are struggling from sleep deprivation.  You’re most likely either finding it hard to sleep early or you are waking up throughout the night. Sleep deprivation can cause you to feel really rough, it is important you don’t ‘over think’ this. During your PL Curriculum you will be given our PL Sleep Plan, which will help alleviate this challenge. You will also be taught how to become a more efficient learner and you will be given the ability to retain and recall a lot more information in a shorter period of time, which will help you to feel less overwhelmed and more in control of your education.

answers.label: Have a solid plan of action, not get distracted so much.  I would like more focus and for it all to be a little bit easier for me.
answers.descriptive_text: Outstanding answer, ‘good on’ you for recognizing that you get distracted and that you are in need of more focus.  You’re getting distracted most likely because you’re finding it’s getting a little bit harder than normal. This is understandable. During your PL Curriculum you will focus on gaining strong skills in the areas where you need to make it all easier for you (major improvements in your memory and having a plan to ensure you keep your concentration levels up).

answers.label: My Maths and Science is good but my English, History and Languages are poor, I'd like to improve this
answers.descriptive_text: This is extremely common and the main reasons are due to the fact that you are most likely naturally stronger in more linear, analytical, problem solving type subjects.  During your PL Curriculum you will be taught the skills to become better in more heavy text, more theory and creative subjects that involve a lot more reading and writing and as a consequence you will become a more ‘whole brain’ learner.

answers.label: My English, History and Languages are good but my Maths and Science is poor, I'd like to improve this
answers.descriptive_text: This is extremely common and the main reasons are due to the fact that you are likely to be naturally stronger in more heavy text, more theory and creative subjects.  During your PL Curriculum you will be taught the skills to become better in more linear, analytical subjects that involve more problem solving, being confident with your formulas and numbers and as a consequence you will become more of a ‘whole brain’ learner.

answers.label: Feel more confident about myself with regards to my academic work, I feel quite depressed at school, sometimes I even feel school isn't right for me
answers.descriptive_text:
We’re sorry to learn that there are times you don’t feel school is right for you. It’s important that if this feeling gets stronger then you seek help and advice from a member of the school’s inclusion or support team.
You’ve stated that you want to feel more confident about your academic work; confidence is often attained through the achievement of top results, by getting better you become more confident. Your PL Curriculum will teach you how to make improvements in your academic work, which will boost your ability to retain and recall information, improve your energy levels, give you a structured plan to manage your time and help you manage any nerves or anxiety you may feel from time to time. Your PL Curriculum will run alongside your school lessons to ensure all of your work is relevant helps you to improve on your results and therefore increases your confidence.

answers.label: None of the above as I am happy with where I am right now
answers.descriptive_text: We suggest you take another look at the answers and see if there is anything else the applies to you, if not, great work as it’s a good place to be if you truly feel there is nothing you would like to improve or focus on.  Make sure you keeping ‘checking in’ on yourself and always write down (even if it’s small) any areas you’d like to improve in. Be proactive in this, as it’ll ensure you keep your focus on what counts.

answers.label: I would like to improve my class participation, though exams and tests go well I often get told I need to participate and work better with my class, be more 'involved'
answers.descriptive_text: Great response, improving your class participation is a good outcome to achieve.  Your PL Curriculum will provide you with lessons around how you can ask more specific questions about areas you need help with as well as gain total clarity on the outcomes of each of your school lessons, which in turn will help you to get more involved.

questions.label: How important is it for you to achieve these outcomes

answers.label: It is extremely important as it will get me to the next step
answers.descriptive_text: Outstanding, perfect response you should be proud of yourself for feeling this way.

answers.label: It is important but by no means paramount
answers.descriptive_text: We are glad to hear it is important for you to achieve your outcomes, make sure you keep your enthusiasm and determination levels high, it’ll get you through any challenging times.

answers.label: Pretty normal, not too bothered either way
answers.descriptive_text: As an immediate next step, write down three things you will achieve by reaching your outcomes.  Then ask yourself how good it would feel to achieve all the outcomes, this will help you feel more compelled and motivated to get the work done and put the effort in.

Make sure you keeping checking in on yourself and always write down (even if it’s small) any areas you’d like to improve in, be proactive in this, as it’ll ensure you keep your focus on what counts.

questions.label: Tell me about times when everything has been going the way you want it to go

answers.label: Everything is flowing and in control
answers.descriptive_text: Outstanding, this flow state you’ve chosen is often described in the sporting world as being “in the zone”, when you’re in that - state your entire biochemistry (head, heart, body) is flowing into one outcome.

answers.label: There are no distractions from anywhere
answers.descriptive_text: Distractions are everywhere and come in many forms, having the ability to block them out and create a distraction-free learning environment is absolutely essential for you to achieve your outcomes.  Getting more efficient in the way you remember information as well as working hard on your time management skills will help you get less distracted, all of this will be covered during your PL Curriculum.

answers.label: I'm not anywhere near as nervous or worried when things are not going well
answers.descriptive_text: Great honesty, managing nerves and anxiety some say is the single most important factor in delivering excellent performance, it applies to all top performers.  Nerves and anxiety appear when you are worrying about an event in the future e.g. your exams to come or focusing on events and experiences e.g. failing an exam in the past. During your PL Curriculum you will be taught how to eliminate all triggers of nerves and anxiety, be provided with proven tools and techniques to manage them if they appear in an exam situation. Most importantly, in one of your PL Lessons you will be build your own pre-, during and -post exam routine which will not only focus on the technical side to your performance but ensure you are in the right mindset to get those results you know you can.

answers.label: I take in and remember information very easily
answers.descriptive_text:
Taking in information easily comes down to about three areas that you need to focus on, which through your PL Curriculum you will have the opportunity to do so: Area One - your state of mind when you’re working.
Area Two - the technique you use to retain and recall information.
Area Three - how you manage your workload on a weekly basis.

answers.label: I feel I can reach and achieve my goals
answers.descriptive_text: Great response, it is clear you have goals you want to achieve; you’re already ahead of most.  The key now is to ensure your weekly efforts are in line with the work required to achieve your goals and your skill levels are high enough to get you there.  This will involve a combination of careful planning, weekly ‘checking in’ and acquiring the skills you need to reach your goals; all of which will be covered through your PL Curriculum.

answers.label: I am turning up to school more than normal
answers.descriptive_text: It’s good of you to notice that you need to show up more then you are. If you don’t show up - you don’t have any chance to turn your performance around.  By showing up, you are giving yourself the opportunity you deserve to progress in school and fulfil your true potential.  Often you can feel like not turning up because you feel like you’re not progressing and getting the results you deserve. By being on the PL Curriculum - you will build a set of skills that will make school easier for you. Just by making improvements in your memory - you will notice results in your work - so give it chance, you deserve.

answers.label: I feel I have more energy and I am not as tired as normal
answers.descriptive_text: We are sorry to hear this, at first instance it appears you are struggling from Sleep deprivation.  You’re most likely either finding it hard to sleep early or are waking up throughout the night; sleep deprivation can cause you to feel really rough, it is important you don’t “over think” this, during your PL Curriculum you will given our PL Sleep Plan which will help alleviate this challenge, you will also be taught how to become a more efficient learner, be given the ability to retain and recall a lot more information in a shorter period of time which will help you too feel less overwhelmed and more in control of your school.

answers.label: Everyone believes in me
answers.descriptive_text: We all know that when people believe in us everything appears easier, however true, sustainable performance comes from us believing in ourselves, especially at times when we are doubting ourselves.  Through the PL Curriculum you will take part in lessons, which are geared towards building your internal resilience, increasing your focus (especially around challenging times at school) and be taught core skills to help you boost your results and grades.  Remember true champions believe in themselves even when others doubt.

answers.label: Nothing has gone right for me
answers.descriptive_text: We’re sorry to hear this, it’s time to turn things around and get the results you not only want but also deserve.  During your PL Curriculum you will be given the opportunity look at your entire academic performance, take each subject and set your goals for them as well as be taught core skills to help you boost your results and grades.

During your PL Curriculum you will see just how many strengths you have. Often at times it’s about how information is presented to you as opposed to your ability to understand information. You will be taught skills to massively boost your memory in a fun and easy way, as well as gaining control of any nerves or anxiety you may feel towards tests and exams.  ‘Hang in’ there, it’s not as difficult as it can appear at times, with the right skills you’ll learn through PL -2 and you will propel your performance.

questions.label: How do you mostly feel in class?

answers.label: Tired
answers.descriptive_text: We are sorry to hear this, at first instance it appears you are struggling from Sleep deprivation.  You’re most likely either finding it hard to sleep early or are waking up throughout the night; sleep deprivation can cause you to feel really rough, it is important you don’t “over think” this. During your PL Curriculum, you will be given our PL Sleep Plan, which will help alleviate this challenge. You will also be taught how to become a more efficient learner, be given the ability to retain and recall a lot more information in a shorter period of time, which will help you to feel less overwhelmed and more in control of your school

answers.label: Bored
answers.descriptive_text:
Boredom often occurs through: 1) lack of stimulation 2) participation or 3) early stages of burn out. It is important for you to find out which one it is (and it can be a combination of all three). Your immediate next step, prior to your PL Curriculum is to write down the answers to the following questions:

1. When was the last time I felt interested and motivated to learn?
2. What was different then? What’s changed?
3. For the next two weeks in class, what can I do differently? What has to change in order for me to feel less bored and more motivated and interested in what I am being taught?

Bring these answers to your first PL Lesson and share them with your PL Teacher.

answers.label: Distracted
answers.descriptive_text: Great honesty, one of the core reasons why you get distracted is more of a technical one then a behavioural one. During your PL Curriculum you will be taught how to take effective notes in class, how to maintain your focus when the teacher is teaching challenging material and how to retain and recall what you’ve been taught in class. Learning these crucial skills will help you greatly in maintaining your focus in class as well retaining what you’re being taught.

answers.label: Active and alert
answers.descriptive_text: Outstanding work, keep up your great progress

answers.label: Motivated and interested to learn
answers.descriptive_text: Outstanding work, keep up your great progress

You’ll also be taught how to manage your nerves and anxiety as well as control your stress levels. Learning these crucial skills will help you greatly in maintaining your focus in class as well retaining what you’re being taught.
If your feeling of anger and frustration continues through your PL Curriculum it’s important that you seek help and advice from a member of the school’s inclusion or support team.

Therefore, during your PL Curriculum you will be taught how to check your work within time limits. In addition to this, the PL  ‘on the go’, short, sharp, high intensity bursts of focus along with PL’s Exam Management and Exam Paper Tools Techniques will assist you in eliminating careless, silly mistakes for good.

answers.descriptive_text:
Great honesty and it’s extremely good of you to be aware that this happens in a test or an exam. Often this occurs due to nerves and anxiety kicking in. Nerves and anxiety cause changes in your body’s biochemistry. You start to develop a “fight” or “flight” response e.g. stress and frustration because you can’t remember or you have detachment and lack of caring because it’s too overwhelming.
During your PL Curriculum you will be taught clear pre-, during and -post exam routines, which will help you to not blank out in tests and exams. Remember your memory is linked to your emotional state of mind, your focus determines your behaviour and your feelings determine your focus.

questions.label: What time do you go to bed?

answers.label: 7-8pm
answers.descriptive_text:
Thank you for your response. Getting to bed at this time is early, and often can be as a result of sleep deprivation and exhaustion. During your PL Curriculum you will be given a PL Sleep Plan, follow it carefully. Through the combination of your PL Lessons and your PL Sleep Plan, you will be able to reduce your levels of exhaustion and get to bed at a more appropriate hour.
It is important for you to know that getting a good night’s sleep requires the following:
1. Being on top and in control of your school work
2. Managing your stress and anxiety levels
3. Consistent bed times during the week as in the weekend (only a 90 min to two hour variation)
A combination of all of the above activities (plus your PL Sleep Plan) will be taught to you during your PL Curriculum to ensure you get a good night’s sleep.

answers.label: I wake up through the night
answers.descriptive_text:
Thank you for your response, as an immediate next step please ensure you write down how many times you wake up through the night and inform your PL Teacher during your PL Lessons so they can guide you on your PL Sleep Plan.
Taking 1-2 hours to get to sleep is a concern to us because it should typically take you between 15 to 45 min (maximum). Anything post 45-minutes can be due to an ability to switch off, anxiety or concern or poor sleep hygiene.
During your PL Sleep lessons you will be taught the following:
1. Being on top and in control of your school work
2. Managing your stress and anxiety levels
3. Consistent bed times during the week as in the weekend (only a 90 min to two hour variation)
4. Maintaining your energy levels as the week progresses
5. Pre bed time routines
6. How to get back to sleep should you wake up in the night
If this problem persists please do consult medical advice, frequent waking through the night is not to be taken lightly.

questions.label: What do you do 30-45 minutes before bed?

answers.label: On the computer / ipad
answers.descriptive_text: Thank you for your response, it is important that 45 minutes before bed you have a consistent routine to help you get to sleep.  If you have answered “yes” or “sometimes/rarely” for the question that asked if you wake up feeling refreshed, then it is critical that during your PL Sleep Lessons you focus on your pre-sleep routine, which your PL Teacher will provide you with.  Avoiding artificial light, which is emitted from you bright screens, is crucial prior to you going to sleep. Too much exposure to artificial light before bedtime can prevent your body/brain from releasing melatonin, (the vital hormone which helps you sleep) and your body/brain stays away, thinking that it’s daylight.
